thread.title: Seattle Mariners name Los Angels Angeles assistant GM and former catcher Scott Servais as new manager
thread.title_full: Seattle Mariners name Los Angels Angeles assistant GM and former catcher Scott Servais as new manager

author: Jen McCaffrey | jmccaffr@masslive.com
title: Seattle Mariners name Los Angels Angeles assistant GM and former catcher Scott Servais as new manager
text:
Seattle Mariners name Los Angels Angeles assistant GM and former catcher Scott Servais as new manager seattle-mariners-scott-servais-manager.jpg Scott Sevais, a former catcher, will become the fifth major league manager with no previous professional experience when the Seattle Mariners officially announce his hiring on Friday. (AP/Andy Kuno) Comments 
The Seattle Mariners named Los Angeles Angels assistant general manager Scott Servais as their new manager on Friday, according to multiple reports. 
Servais, is another former catcher with no previous managerial or coaching experience, who has been tapped for a big league managing position. 
Jason Varitek, who's currently serving as a special assistant in Boston, had interviewed for the job, but it was unclear how serious he was about relocating to Seattle. 
Varitek also has no previous managerial or coaching experience since retiring in 2011. 
Servais will become the fifth current major league manager (Kevin Cash, Brad Ausmus, A.J. Hinch and Mike Matheny) who caught in the majors and will serve a manager with no experience. 
Tim Bogar, who was a coach in Boston from 2009-12, will be Servais' bench coach. Source: Tim Bogar, who was a finalist for #Mariners MGR job, will serve as bench coach under Scott Servais. — Mike DiGiovanna (@MikeDiGiovanna) October 23, 2015 Servais, a former major-league catcher, currently assistant GM for #Angels . Worked under new #Mariners GM Jerry Dipoto in that capacity. — Ken Rosenthal (@Ken_Rosenthal) October 22, 2015
